intro: Cereus nanus, commonly known as the dwarf holiday cactus, is a small, compact cactus native to South America. It features a short, branching stem covered in white, woolly spines. Its flowers are typically pink or red, appearing during the winter months. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in bright, indirect sunlight. It is popular as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
